intro: Cordyline rosacea, commonly known as the pink torch, is a striking ornamental plant native to New Zealand. It features tall, upright stems with broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically pink to red in color, giving it its common name. The plant belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types. It produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that appear in clusters at the base of the plant. Cordyline rosacea is often cultivated for its attractive foliage and is well-suited for both indoor and outdoor growing conditions.
